properties.text: Welcome and thank you for downloading the Official Tinkers' Survival Modpack. If you didn't download this from CurseForge, please delete and download from there!

This is a project that was started when ashar42 wanted to make Minecraft actually challenging again. Back in the Beta days, survival was tough. Surviving your first night was problematic. Well, that changed when Notch hired folks who basically made it more like Animal Crossing than a zombie apocalypse survival game. This is a reinvented game based around that concept. This is NOT Vanilla Minecraft, don't try to play it like it is! 

We hope you enjoy! Click the button below to join us on Discord!
You may notice right away some small piles of rocks lying randomly on the ground throughout the world. Break and gather them, they are a valuable resource and needed for crafting tools.
Gathering Required Materials
Punching leaves and will drop sticks. The drop rate is not great but it will allow you to get sticks. Once you craft a knife, you can use it to increase the drop rate.
You'll need to find gravel and either craft it into flint or break gravel repeatedly until you get some.

Crude tools need Flint Shards!
Simply knapp (right-click) Flint on a hard surface (preferably regular Stone blocks) and with a bit of luck, you can split them in half.

Next you'll need to get some Plant Fiber. Plant Fiber is a new drop when breaking grass with the knife.

You'll need Plant Fiber to craft Plant String used in crafting the Crude Hatchet, Crude Saw and Crude Bandages and Bandages.
Once you have the flint knife, you can also craft flint shards:
Now, it is time to craft your first tool! Using a stick and a flint shard, you'll be able to craft the crude knife. Don't forget to collect your heart from the quest menu!

Now that you have Rocks, Sticks and Flint Shards, you can start to gather and process wood!
Start by crafting yourself a Crude Hatchet to chop down your first tree.

Don't forget to collect your heart container for completing this step!

Let's process the acquired wood by crafting a saw. Your first saw will be a Crude Saw.
Before you can construct the actual saw, you need to craft a Crude Saw Blade.
Now you are able to craft the Crude Saw.

Now you are able to craft Wooden Planks! You know the next steps. As crude tools are eager to break, your first major goal should be to advance to Tinkers' Construct hatchets and saws. The principle of processing wood remains the same.
Of course processing Wooden Planks to Sticks has changed too. Use your saw again and - bada bing, bada boom - Sticks!

There is quite a variety of biomes. Each biome is a little more hilly than Vanilla to make exploration a bit more interesting. Ores are expanded to include several interesting ores, and an different ore progression mostly based around alloying!

There are 5 mining levels, details of each level - including alloy recipies and mining levels -  are included at the end of this book. To get to top tier tools, weapons and armor, you'll need to progress through each tier by creating materials hard enough to mine the next level.

Stone

Brass

Bronze

Steel

Manyullyn
Mining Levels

Pickaxe progression path:

Stone -> Brass -> Bronze -> Steel -> Manyullyn

Some alloy materials must be obtained to progress. For Steel, check out Immersive Engineering.

- Vanilla and Vanilla-like tools and weapons don't work. All tool progression is based around Tinkers' Construct tools and weapons.

- Vanilla-like armors are disabled entirely. Create armor with Construct's Armory.

- The only way to craft Wooden Planks and Sticks is with a saw.

- Crude tools are necessary to create items needed for crafting Tinkers' tables and tools.

- Move fast or you will probably die.
Introduction

A copy of this book will be included in your starting inventory. Don't worry though. If you die it will remain in your inventory. All other items will be on your corpse.

You will also have access to several quests. These quests are available through built-in quests menu that can be accessed through the default key '~'.

It is important to also remember:

- No sleeping. You'll have to deal with monsters. Hide at night!
Exploration

No minimap is intentional! Don't lose the beauty of exploring and finding things in Minecraft. It is a serious part of the fun. This isn't a first person shooter, so forget that it exists in those games. These aren't the droids you are looking for!



However, you can Shift+RightClick with a compass anywhere on the ground and your compass will point there! Rename in an anvil for as many custom compasses as needed.
Waystones
All villages contain waystones. Find these waystones to be able to quickly travel around the world. You can also craft your own and travel the ways!
RightClick with Nature's Compass in hand will open the biome selection GUI, from which you can search for a biome. Shift+RightClick to reset.
Setting Spawn Point

Even though sleeping is disabled, you can still set a spawn point with a bed. But instead of having to sheer sheep, you can still make a bed very early game with the following steps.

First, smelt plant string into string:
Next, craft string into wool blocks:
Then craft a bed, place and try to sleep. Spawn set!
First Steps Overview
Follow progress on tasks in the quests menu. You'll want the rewards! You'll get heart containers to increase your odds of survival.
Gather materials so you can make some crude tools. Crude tools are essential to work toward making Tinkers' Tools!
Eat and drink! Gather food from gardens, trees and bushes. Right click on a water source to drink. Don't starve or dehydrate!
Days are longer than nights! Once it starts to get dark, find a hidey hole! You can't punch trees, but you can dig dirt, sand and gravel with your hands.
Build a Tinkers' setup, smeltery and the ability to craft tools and armor!
Mine materials to enable crafting of better tools and armor. Progression is custom, mostly centered around alloying!
Tinkers' Construct Setup
To progress, you'll need to be able to make Tinkers' Tools. A pickaxe is necessary for mining. Dirt is faster to dig with a Mattock or Shovel than with your hands.
First, make a crafting station. You can convert a normal crafting table into a crafting station in your crafting grid.
Next you'll need to craft a Stencil Table and a Part Builder. Check JEI for the recipes.
Crafting Tools

If you haven't built tools with Tinkers' Construct before, you'll need a little help getting started.

First, you'll need a pattern. Go to your Stencil Table and place a Blank Pattern into the slot on the left. Select the pattern you want to create, and retrieve it on the right. Note: The pattern isn't made until you pick it up.
Patterns are required for all tool parts. You won't be able to make use of all of them until later, so just make the ones you need.
Casts & Pouring Parts

Once you've got the hang of smelting ores in your Smeltery, you'll want to be able to make parts. First, you'll need a Cast. To make a Cast for a specific part, simply make a single Stone Part. Assuming you were smart and created a Drain with a Faucet above a Casting Table already, you can make a Cast. Casts can be made with either Clay (single use), Brass or Gold. Place the part on the Casting Table, then right click the drain to pour over the part. The part is consumed and you'll be left with a Cast!
Hint: Once you have basic tools, craft a saw. Output is 4 planks per log and the saw is upgradeable like all other Tinkers' tools.
Alloys
Alloys are made automatically in the Smeltery once the correct ingredients are present. Be careful about what you store in the Smeltery, as it may get converted into something else!
Once you've used a Tool for a while, it will level up. With the acquired level, you can add Modifiers that augment the functionality. Check the book for details.
Health

Managing your health is a little more difficult early game. Natural healing is very slow. You'll start healing 1/2 heart every minute five minutes after taking damage. It isn't much, so you'll want to make some bandages.
Crude bandages are good early game. It will heal a little over 2 hearts.
Bandages heal over 4 hearts, so you'll want to make these as soon as possible.
Clean Water

At some point, you'll get tired of the status effect from drinking dirty water with your hands. You'll want to collect or make clean water and a Canteen to cary it in. Canteens allow for three uses and fully refill your water status.
Right click while holding the Canteen on any water source. Place a filter and the filled Canteen in your crafting grid to clean the water!
Extra Life

In the quests you will receive Heart Containers. While these are obtained through quests or Boss drops, they aren't very common. There are a few ways to get more. First, if you gether enough Heart Shard Crystals.
Heart Shard Crystals are dropped randomly by mobs and are also dropped from Heart Crystal Ore.

Steel Mining Material Information

Steel can be made in the Immersive Engineering Blast furnace. Use the book and follow the instructions to be able to make steel.

HINT: Redstone and Gunpowder can be crafted into Blaze Powder needed for the Blast Furnace.
Steel Level Tool Materials
Manyullyn Level Tool Materials

Adamantine
Manyullyn
Star-Steel
Smeltery Alloy Recipes
Manyullyn - Ardite, Cobalt
Manyullyn Mining Material Information
Cooking for Blockheads

This mod adds a cooking book to Minecraft that will only show recipes that you can currently make with the things you carry in your inventory. It also adds an optional upgraded version of the book that can craft the foods right away by simply clicking on the recipes.
Hint: Search @cooking in JEI to view all recipes for the kitchen.

A multi-block kitchen consists of the main component, the Cooking Table, which is the book in block-form and uses the other multi-block Kitchen parts, the Cooking Oven, which can smelt food items only and provides smelting ability to the Cooking Table. A sink provides water for recipes once you plumb it in (See Immersive Engineering). A tool rack which can be used to store Pam's HarvestCraft tools for use in making recipes. Counters and a fridge, where you can store all your ingredients.
Tips

- A good early game source for torches is Charcoal. Smelt Wood using Wood as a fuel into Charcoal! Add a stick: Torches!

- Charcoal, Bonemeal, Gunpowder and Glowstone Dust can all be obtained through crops. Seeds for these are random grass drops.

- Gunpowder + Redstone = Blaze Powder. (Needed for the Blast Furnace).

- Do all the quests!

- A Pocket Watch will allow you to see the time even when underground.

- Make a Presser to convert logs into Paper.

- Ground and Water Traps are a great way to gather food.

- The Shipping Bin and Market are a great way to buy and sell items and seeds.

- Ender Pearls can be grown with Ender Seeds. (grass drop)
Immersive Petroleum adds an essential tool for creating multi-block structures. The Projector. This gives a 3D guide for all IE and Immersive Petroleum machies.

Immersive Petroleum includes all you need to start building your oil empire, including the Pumpjack and Distillation Tower, Portable Generator, Lubricant Can, Automatic Lubricator, Motorboat, Projectors, and Asphalt paving.
Immersive Petroleum

Coke Brick and Blast Brick are needed for making the Coke Oven and Blast Furnace. You'll want to make sure you gather plenty of resources early on to be able to build these.

Note that the Blast Brick requires Nether Brick. This will require a trip to the Nether to gather some Netherrack. Just smelt the Netherrack to get Nether Brick.
Animania

Animania is an immersive mod that replaces and improves the passive animals in Minecraft, adding multiple breeds, genders, new behaviors, and several new species.

For animals to be happy, they must have access to a consistent supply of food and water, and in some cases (like Pigs) need a place to have fun (like a mud pit)

All animals can use a lead (you will need it). 

Be sure to complete the Animania quest to get the manual.
Pendant of Life
Don't like having to find and loot your corpse? Create a Pendant of Life. If this is in your inventory when you die, you'll respawn with all your items. Check JEI for the recipe.
Wards

Wards allows you to use those enchanted books you have lying around and put them to good use. This mod only comes with one block: the ward. A ward block draws enchantments from an enchanted book to ward an area, providing buffs for the player and damaging mobs.
Storage Drawers

Storage Drawers is a very powerful multi-block solution for your storage needs. This is a very powerful and configurable way to introduce storage into your base. Be sure to check out drawer upgrades to increase drawer storage and more!
The Chest Transporter gives the ability to transport storage drawers and chests without breaking them. You can move spawners with the Obsidian Chest Transporter as well. Grind on!
Iron Backpacks are a tiered portable storage. Just upgrade your backpack and you can store more stuff!
Need to transport fluids across large distances or through dimensions? Well you'll need an EnderTank.
Chisel
Chisels and Bits

Chisel adds a huge variety of decorative blocks to the game. The mod is very useful for people who like the construction aspect of Minecraft. 

Access to new blocks is provided mostly through one tool, the chisel. The iron chisel is created with a iron ingot and a stick in a diagonal pattern.

Right clicking opens the chiseling interface.

There is a more sophisticated version of the Chisel tool, named the iChisel. It is spring-loaded with many helpful features.

This mod adds several chisels, a wrench and ways to copy designs and store bits. These tools enable you to create new custom decorative blocks and designs to decorate your bases and improve the flexibility of your building style.

The possibilities are virtually endless!
Wikis (Click icon to open)

Animania


Chisels and Bits


Tough As Nails


Cooking for Blockheads


Ashenwheat

Oh, right you wanted to travel to The End. Well you'll need to craft Eyes of Ender right? Well that will require smelting an Ender Pearl, Blaze Powder and Gasoline together in an Arc Furnace. Be careful though, as the by-product is nasty stuff! Do not drink! You have been warned.


                 The End
World Difficulty and Health

World difficulty is set to Hard. There are a number extra monsters and features added to all mobs:

- Smarter more aware zombies (and skeletons, spiders), they track you down via blood scent, sound, and light source awareness.

There is both an area difficulty and player difficulty score calculated. This determines how difficult monsters become. Camp in groups, it gets harder. Kill more monsters, it gets harder. Be cautious about killing too many monsters early game.
Special Mob Features

Undead mobs (Zombies and Skeletons) have damage reduction and health regeneration. The only way to depower the undead is to smite them, either through fire damage (unless immune) or holy damage. Silver weapons/tools and a variety of other types of holy weapons are available.

A great early game smite tool is the Fire Stick:
Immersive Engineering

Immersive Engineering (IE) is a tech mod created by Damien Hazard.

IE is about making tech mods more balanced and more pretty, and adding its own twist by going for retro-futurism, rather than clinical white+grey future cubes. IE -- along with the companion mod Immersive Petroleum -- also provides the only way to get Steel, Eyes of Ender and Pipes.

The mod features Power Generation in forms of waterwheels, windmills, biodiesel and more and many of its machines are multiblocks!

Be sure to complete the IE quest to get a copy of the "Engineer's Manual".

You'll want to start with the sections on the Coke Oven and Blast Furnace, as these are essential machines, not only for IE, but also for tool progression for Steel.

Tips:

- Better to use full blocks of Coal and Iron as it is more efficent.

- Waterwheel is an excellent early game power source. Check the book and Youtube for ideas!

Now that you have a pattern, you'll need a part. For more basic materials, you can make parts in the Part Builder. Place the Pattern in the Part Builder along with the desired materials and pick up the output item on the right.
With Parts in hand, use the Tool Station to assemble. Select the Tool on the left, then place the parts in the relevant slots. Pick the assembled Tool on the Right.
Part Builder
Tool Repair

Repairing Tools Requires the Tool Station (or Tool Forge). Select the Repair icon on the left. Place your Tool in the indicated slot in the middle on the right. In any of the surrounding slots, place the repair material. The repair material is the same as the Tool Head. So a Pickaxe with a Stone Head will be repaired with Stone or Cobblestone.
Sharpening Kits are a great way to repair on the go. Just make a Pattern and craft a Kit in the Part Builder.
Armor

Vanilla armor is so last season. You'll need to craft armor using the Armor Station. Once you've crafted the station, grab your copy of the "Armory Addendum" as a quest reward in the Construct's Armory Quest.
Hint: Heating and cooling parts can be made to help with weather conditions.

The concept of Armor is the same as Tools and Weapons in Tinkers' Construct. You'll want to create Patterns and Parts for your Armor and assemble in the Armor Station. Eventually, you'll also create Casts for parts with more advanced materials.
Armor also levels up like tools and weapons. Once your Armor levels up, you can add Modifiers to it to gain new abilities. Check the book for Modifier properties.

Instructions are available in "Materials and You" book, a reward in the Tinkers' Construct quest. Click the "recycle" symbol in the upper right corner on the Smeltery page to get an animated guide to building the Smeltery.
Upgrading Tools

To progress in the game, you'll need to upgrade your tool materials. Many can only be cast using the Smeltery, a multi-block structure where Ores and other materials can be Smelted or Combined into Alloys.

One problem you'll find is that to make a basic smeltery function, you'll need Lava. That's where the Clay Bucket comes in. The Clay Bucket is a one time use bucket that will allow you to fill the heat source for your smeltery. Fire the bucket in a furnace to create a usable bucket.
All alloys, needed mining materials, and mining levels are found in the end of this book for reference. Happy mining!
